        program chain
        implicit none

        i = 1

                if (s0(i:i+1) == "BC") then
                    k = k + 1
                    temp(k) = 'D'
                    i = i + 2
                    cycle
                endif
            endif
            k = k + 1
            temp(k) = s0(i:i)
            i = i + 1
        end do

        ! Allocate s0_transformed to length k
        allocate(character(len=k) :: s0_transformed)
        do i=1, k
            s0_transformed(i:i) = temp(i)
        end do

        ! Step 2: count the pattern

        tmp = 0
        do i=1, k

        nlen = len_trim(s1)      ! get the length without trailing spaces

        ! Step 4: frequency count for the string s1(1:nlen)

            ascii = ichar(s1(i:i))
            freq(ascii) = freq(ascii) + 1
        end do

        distinct = 0
        flag = .true.
        do ascii = 0, 255
            if (freq(ascii) > 0) then
                distinct = distinct + 1
                if (freq(ascii) /= 2) then
                    flag = .false.
                end if
            end if
        end do

        if (distinct == 2 .and. flag) then
            write(*, '(a)') 'Yes'
        else
            write(*, '(a)') 'No'
        end if

        program chain
        implicit none
        character(len=200000) :: s0
        character(len=1), allocatable :: temp(:)
        character(len=:), allocatable :: s0_transformed
        integer :: i, k, len0, nlen, ascii, distinct
        integer(kind=8) :: cnt8, tmp_count
        character(len=20) :: s1
        integer :: freq(0:255)
        logical :: flag

        ! Step 1: read the input string (as a token)
        read(*, *) s0
        len0 = len_trim(s0)

        ! If the string is empty, we still need to process? 
        if (len0 == 0) then
            ! Then the transformed string is empty, cnt8=0, then s1="0", then distinct=1 -> output "No"
            ! So we can proceed as below, but we avoid the loop.
            allocate(character(len=0) :: s0_transformed)
            cnt8 = 0
        else
            ! Allocate temp array for building transformed string
            allocate(temp(len0))
            k = 0
            i = 1
            do while (i <= len0)
                if (i < len0) then
                    if (s0(i:i+1) == "BC") then
                        k = k + 1
                        temp(k) = 'D'
                        i = i + 2
                        cycle
                    end if
                end if
                k = k + 1
                temp(k) = s0(i:i)
                i = i + 1
            end do

            ! Allocate s0_transformed to length k
            allocate(character(len=k) :: s0_transformed)
            do i=1, k
                s0_transformed(i:i) = temp(i)
            end do

            ! Count the pattern
            cnt8 = 0
            tmp_count = 0
            do i=1, k
                if (s0_transformed(i:i) == 'A') then
                    tmp_count = tmp_count + 1
                else if (s0_transformed(i:i) == 'D') then
                    cnt8 = cnt8 + tmp_count
                else
                    tmp_count = 0
                end if
            end do

            deallocate(temp)   ! not necessary, but if we care about memory
        end if

        ! Convert cnt8 to string
        write(s1, '(I0)') cnt8
        s1 = adjustl(s1)
        nlen = len_trim(s1)

        ! Frequency count for the string s1(1:nlen)
        freq = 0
        do i=1, nlen
            ascii = ichar(s1(i:i))
            if (ascii >= 0 .and. ascii <= 255) then
                freq(ascii) = freq(ascii) + 1
            end if
        end do

        distinct = 0
        flag = .true.
        do ascii = 0, 255
            if (freq(ascii) > 0) then
                distinct = distinct + 1
                if (freq(ascii) /= 2) then
                    flag = .false.
                end if
            end if
        end do

        if (distinct == 2 .and. flag) then
            write(*, '(a)') 'Yes'
        else
            write(*, '(a)') 'No'
        end if

        end program chain
